meanings.definition: To flow or move with a bubbling sound
meanings.sent1: The stream was gurging gently over the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the water gurging in the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The baby found the gurging water in the bath amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter gurged out like a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: The gurging river carried fallen leaves downstream.

meanings.definition: A gurgling sound made by liquid
meanings.sent1: The gurging of the coffee pot signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent2: I heard the gurging of the water as I poured it into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The gurging of the soda can made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The gurging of the stream was music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The gurging of the tea kettle filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: To make a gurgling sound in the throat, as in swallowing or choking
meanings.sent1: She was gurging as she tried to swallow the large pill.
meanings.sent2: The child started gurging when he accidentally inhaled water.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to gurge on his drink for a joke.
meanings.sent4: The engine gurged as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The old pipes gurged noisily when the water was turned on.
